article.headline: Indiana 72, N.C. Central 56
article.story: BLOOMINGTON, Ind. -- Christian Watford scored 17 points and Jordan Hulls added 15 as Indiana held off North Carolina Central 72-56 on Tuesday night. The Hoosiers are off to their first 5-0 start since 2002-03. Landon Clement had 17 points to pace the Eagles (1-3), who extended their road losing streak to 43. They haven't won on the road since beating Coppin State on Jan. 30, 2008, and are 0-4 all-time against Big Ten schools. But it wasn't easy for Indiana. The Eagles took a 20-19 lead midway through the first half and were within 27-24 with 3:09 left. But Indiana scored the final seven points to make it 34-24 at halftime -- courtesy of Victor Oladipo's 60-foot buzzer-beating heave. North Carolina Central closed to 38-35 early in the second half, but Indiana answered with an 11-0 run and the Eagles never again got closer than seven.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
